name: Titanium.Media.Sound
summary: An object for playing basic audio resources.

events.name: change
events.summary: Fired when the state of the playback changes.
events.description: This event can be generated by programmatic events, such as pausing or stopping the audio, and also by external events, such as the current state of network buffering.

properties.name: state
properties.summary: Current state of playback.

properties.name: description
properties.summary: Text description of the state of playback.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: complete
events.summary: Fired when the audio has finished playing.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Indicates if the sound was played successfully. Returns true if request succeeded, false otherwise.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. Will be undefined if success is true.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: Error code. Error code will be 0 if success is true, nonzero otherwise. If the error was generated by the operating system, that system's error value is used. Otherwise, this value will be -1.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: error
events.summary: Fired when an error occurs while playing the audio.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Indicates a successful operation. Returns false.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. May be undefined.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: Error code. If the error was generated by the operating system, that system's error value is used. Otherwise, this value will be -1.

properties.name: message
properties.summary: Error message. Use the error property instead.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: interrupted
events.summary: Fired when audio playback is interrupted by the device.
events.description: Typically called during an interruption due to an incoming phone call.

events.name: resume
events.summary: Fired when audio playback is resumed after an interruption.

properties.name: interruption
properties.summary: Indicates if the resume was from an interruption.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: play
methods.summary: Starting playing the sound, or resume playing a paused sound.

methods.name: release
methods.description: This is typically unnecessary but can be useful if you load a large audio file in app.js, and play it only once and you would like to release all resources after your final play to reduce memory.

methods.name: reset
methods.summary: Resets the audio playback position to the beginning.

methods.name: setPaused
methods.description: On iOS, this method can be used to pause and unpause playback. For portability, it is preferable to use the pause and play methods instead.

parameters.name: paused
parameters.summary: Pass true to pause the current playback temporarily, false to unpause it.

methods.name: stop
methods.summary: Stops playing the audio and resets the playback position to the beginning of the clip.

properties.name: allowBackground
properties.summary: Determines whether the audio should continue playing even when its activity is paused.

properties.name: audioType
properties.summary: Changes the audio-stream-type.

properties.name: duration
properties.summary: Duration of the audio resource.
properties.description:
On iOS, playback time is reported in seconds.

On Android, time is reported in milliseconds.

Android note: Starting from Titanium 3.2.0, the remote audio plays asynchronously. The duration can only be fetched after the audio is initialized (refer to STATE_INITIALIZED).

properties.name: looping
properties.summary: Determines whether the audio should loop upon completion.

properties.name: paused
properties.summary: Indicates if the audio is paused.
properties.description:
On iOS, this property is read-write, and you can pause and resume playback by setting this property to true or false.

On Android, this property is read-only. For portability, use pause to pause audio, and play to resume.

properties.name: playing
properties.summary: Indicates if the audio is playing.

properties.name: time
properties.summary: Current playback position of the audio.
properties.description:
Time is reported in milliseconds.

On iOS, prior to Release 3.0, playback time is reported in seconds.

properties.name: url
properties.summary: URL identifying the audio resource.

properties.name: volume
properties.summary: Volume of the audio from 0.0 (muted) to 1.0 (loudest).
properties.description:
This setting controls the volume of the sound relative to the overall volume setting for the device.

On iOS, to adjust the volume of the device, set the volume property of appMusicPlayer and set the audioSessionMode property to either AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_SOLO_AMBIENT, AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_PLAYBACK, or AUDIO_SESSION_CATEGORY_PLAYBACK.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_ALARM
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for alarms.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_MEDIA
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for media playback.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_NOTIFICATION
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for notifications.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_RING
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for the phone ring.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_SIGNALLING
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for DTMF tones or beeps.

constants.name: AUDIO_TYPE_VOICE
constants.summary: Used to identify the volume of audio streams for voice calls.

constants.name: STATE_BUFFERING
constants.summary: Audio data is being buffered from the network.

constants.name: STATE_WAITING_FOR_DATA
constants.summary: Player is waiting for audio data from the network.

constants.name: STATE_WAITING_FOR_QUEUE
constants.summary: Player is waiting for audio data to fill the queue.
